# Generating random data

This folder contains extensions that help in generating random data useful for basic data-driven tests.

## Random name

**<u>Description</u>**: This NLP extension allows you to generate a random name from a list of pre-defined array of names.

**<u>How to Use</u>**:

1. Write a step: **Random name** returning $result**.
2. By default, there is a list of names from which this random name is picked.
3. If you wan to change the names or add more names, you can edit the extension and add/edit the `names` array variable.
4. The extension will return a random name in the response.

**<u>Add to Virtuoso</u>**:

- <a href="https://app2.virtuoso.qa/#/add-language-extension?name=Random%20name&org=true&%3D%3D" class="button big">Add to app2 (Free trial) env</a>
- <a href="https://app.virtuoso.qa/#/add-language-extension?name=Random%20name&org=true&%3D%3D" class="button big">Add to app (Production) env</a>

## Random number in a range

**<u>Description</u>**: This NLP extension allows you to generate a random number from a range.

**<u>How to Use</u>**:

1. Write a step: **NumberInRange(min, max)** returning $result**.
2. `min` and `max` are the endpoints of the specified range.
3. The extension will return a random number in between this range.

**<u>Add to Virtuoso</u>**:

- <a href="https://app2.virtuoso.qa/#/add-language-extension?name=NumberInRange&org=true&%3D%3D" class="button big">Add to app2 (Free trial) env</a>
- <a href="https://app.virtuoso.qa/#/add-language-extension?name=NumberInRange&org=true&%3D%3D" class="button big">Add to app (Production) env</a>

## Random dropdown value

**<u>Description</u>**: This NLP extension allows you to generate a random number from a range.

**<u>How to Use</u>**:

To use it, you need to write three steps:

1. For a given dropdown, store the dropdown values. To do this, open the **Advanced** mode in **live preview**. Then use the inspect tool to click on the dropdown and grab the main classname of the dropdown.
2. Then write a step: `Store element text of "<classname>" in $text`.
3. This will store all the dropdown options into an array of data.
4. Next, write a step to randomly pick a value from the array of data: `RandomDropdownValue() returning $dropdown`.
5. Then you can use that to pick from the dropdown e.g. `Pick $dropdown from dropdown "<dropdown name>"`. Note if the dropdown is not indexed, you may need to write: `Click "<default value shown in the dropdown>"`.
6. `Click $dropdown`.

**<u>Add to Virtuoso</u>**:

- <a href="https://app2.virtuoso.qa/#/add-language-extension?name=RandomDropdownValue&org=true&%%2BKE1hdGgucmFuZG9tKCkgKiBsaXN0Lmxlbmd0aCldO1xyXG5yZXR1cm4gcmFuZDtcclxuIiwiaW5wdXRzIjpbInRleHQiXSwiYXN5bmMiOmZhbHNlLCJsYXN0TW9kaWZpZWQiOjE2OTEwNjAyODc5NDMsInJlc291cmNlcyI6W10sImRpcmVjdGl2ZSI6ZmFsc2UsImRlc2NyaXB0aW9uIjoiIn0%3D" class="button big">Add to app2 (Free trial) env</a>
- <a href="https://app.virtuoso.qa/#/add-language-extension?name=RandomDropdownValue&org=true&%%2BKE1hdGgucmFuZG9tKCkgKiBsaXN0Lmxlbmd0aCldO1xyXG5yZXR1cm4gcmFuZDtcclxuIiwiaW5wdXRzIjpbInRleHQiXSwiYXN5bmMiOmZhbHNlLCJsYXN0TW9kaWZpZWQiOjE2OTEwNjAyODc5NDMsInJlc291cmNlcyI6W10sImRpcmVjdGl2ZSI6ZmFsc2UsImRlc2NyaXB0aW9uIjoiIn0%3D" class="button big">Add to app (Production) env</a>
